did.unittitle: Board of Directors of Horticultural Hall minutes

bioghist.p: The Pennsylvania Horticultural Society is Americaâ€™s first horticultural society and was formed in 1827 as a not-for-profit membership organization. The Committee on a New Hall was established in 1865 by D. Rodney King, the president of the Pennsylvania Horticultural Society. This committee was charged with raising funds for the construction of the society's first Horticultural Hall. In 1866, King appointed directors of the new Horticultural Hall. The board included King, W.L. Schaffer, and Henry A. Dreer. The first Horticultural Hall was lost to fire in 1881. A new hall was completed in 1882; this building burned down in 1893. The society's third Horticultural Hall was completed in 1896. The third Hall was sold in 1917. Much of the work of the board was carried out by the Building and Finance committees, which reported their progress at monthly meetings of the board. There were annual meetings and special meetings for the stockholders of Horticultural Hall.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the minutes of the Board of Directors of Horticultural Hall, 1866-1881 and 1887-1909. The minutes document the monthly meetings of the board, which oversaw the planning, construction, and maintenance of the first Horticultural Hall. There are some minutes that relate to the second and the third Horticultural Halls. The minutes include reports from the Building committee, as well as some financial information about rental income for the hall and records of some of its expenses. In addition to minutes of monthly meetings, the first volume includes the group's by-laws and minutes of annual and special meetings of stockholders (1866-1876).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
